reviewText: I have only watched Twister so far. We were a bit disappointed in the reproduction of this classic as some seems become blotchy, pixelated, and lacked vividness in color. Other parts looked very good. In fairness we have not watched the other two movies as of yet.

I would encourage anyone to upgrade their older VHS or DVD movies to at least Bluray 2D quality (3D for those who have 3D grade TVs) as the quality of the picture is 100% better then VHS tapes and nearly 50% better then DVD's. The sound quality has been improved and upgraded as well. Most Blu-rays have many more features that can be viewed as well which make for a much fuller movie experience too! Oh and just so you know, even if you don't own a Bluray movie you should go buy an on sale Bluray player. Why? Because a Bluray player scans the disk many more times than just a standard DVD player, that it will even make your older DVD movies look much better. That is, as long as you have a flat screen type of TV that was purchased in the last five years. Good luck and go get some!
very good dvd

This is my first WB Triple Feature blu-ray set so I was a little weary of how these sets would be produced mainly due to some pretty crummy standard DVD sets I've seen over the years. Luckily with these blu-rays, this doesn't seem to be a problem.  Like the previous reviewer has said, you get each film on its own individual disc complete with its own special features.

  I won't go into specific reviews but overall I am extremely happy with this Nature Gone Wild-themed set. Here you get the two 4-star movies Twister and Poseidon as well as the 3-star, made for tv feel movie The Perfect Storm.  All three look and sound amazing and are sure to entertain for years to come without losing a single pixil or color scheme.

I've seen these DVD sets in the past that have "Double Features" and it's sometimes one movie one each side of the disc, or both movies on one side, and you choose which movie you want with the menu. It was very low budget, in my opinion.

This Blu Ray "Triple Feature" actually has all THREE movies on their own disc, but in one case. It has dividers, just like a CD double album.

I was very surprised and satisfied.

So, for the price of $9.99 ( that was what I paid here on Amazon ) you get THREE Blu Ray movies.

BOTTOM LINE: Trio of older natural disaster-themed films bundled together in a 3-disc Blu-ray set is a solid value. Recommended. 4 STARS

TWISTER is my favorite of the three. I always enjoy this brainless bad weather movie. I love the late Bill Paxton. His memorable turn as Pvt. Hudson in ALIENS was a classic role. Plus, he always seemed to be genuinely having fun while on camera, no matter what kind of part he was playing. I'll check out just about anything he's in. Helen Hunt is easy on the eyes and delivers her techno-speak fairly believably. Her rowdy gang of unkempt storm chasers are a goofy, fun bunch; the kind of guys you'd want to hang with after work for a beer. Cary Elwes makes for a suitably hiss-worthy corporate kiss-butt bad guy. The effects, though somewhat primitive by modern standards, are ambitious and still do their job nicely, plus the non-stop dangers are harmless fun to watch.

POSEIDON is a well-mounted but ultimately pointless remake of the seminal granpappy of the star-studded disaster genre. Competent at every turn, but frankly the only fun comes from figuring out which old Poseidon Adventure characters these new actors are supposed to be playing - and who will live or die. The whole thing looks pretty good, but sadly the film feels rushed and the characters so under-developed that you really don't get to know enough about them to care who makes it and who bites the big one. A pretty serious flaw. I'm a big Kurt Russel fan though, so if he's in something, I'll check it out.

THE PERFECT STORM is a well-done but grim outing. Being based on tragic real life events, there's no way to honestly tell anything other than a relentlessly sad and ultimately depressing tale. George Clooney & Co. are very believable in their respective roles of working class fishermen consigned to their fates due to pig-headed stubbornness & heartless corporate greed. It's all very well done, and director Wolfgang (DAS BOOT) Peterson faithfully captures the look & feel of the weary blue collar sword fishing industry quite well. Just don't watch this expecting a happy ending. Flick is still worth an occasional spin just for the quality of the acting. And I gotta give credit to the production team, cast & crew for having the balls to tell the story truthfully, without giving it some BS happy Hollywood ending. (Because like it or not, sometimes we need to be reminded that life isn't always happy & fun.)

THE BLU-RAYS: All 3 films all look & sound great. The special features for each film remain intact. In fact, the discs appear to be the same as when each movie was released individually, so you're getting all three movies complete in one space-saving package. This is an affordable deal for the casual film collector and anyone who's a fan of these kinds of films. Enjoyable time-killers to watch when the weather is nasty enough to keep you inside for the evening. ;-) 4 STARS.
Thanks!

This isn't really a review, but as I found the product description lacking, I decided to compile this list of helpful information below. I hope this will be useful for prospective buyers to know what they're getting:

TWISTER (1996): 113 minutes - Director: Jan de Bont - Starring: Helen Hunt, Bill Paxton, Phillip Seymour Hoffman - Genre: Action, disaster - Plot: Bill and Jo Harding, advanced storm chasers on the brink of divorce, must join together to create an advanced weather alert system by putting themselves in the cross-hairs of extremely violent tornadoes. PG-13

POSEIDON (2006): 98 minutes - Director: Wolfgang Petersen - Starring: Richard Dreyfuss, Kurt Russell - Genre: Action, disaster- Plot: On New Year's Eve, the luxury ocean liner, Poseidon, capsizes after being swamped by a rogue wave. The survivors are left to fight for survival as they attempt to escape the sinking ship. PG-13

THE PERFECT STORM (2000): 130 minutes - Director: Wolfgang Petersen - Starring: George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, Diane Lane - Genre: Action, disaster - Plot: An unusually intense storm pattern catches some commercial fishermen unaware and puts them in mortal danger. PG-13

Now let's crunch some numbers. This collection costs $9.96, and contains 3 films. To find the value of the individual film you're getting, we divide the price by the number of films to get an individual price of $3.32 per film, an absolute steal for this thrilling and action-packed set of disaster films! I hope this information is useful to you. Cheers!

Director Wolfgang Petersen's POSEIDON with Josh Lucas and Kurt Russell plays much better today than when it was first released. This is essentially an interesting re-make of Irwin Allen's THE POSEIDON ADVENTURE original released in 1972. It focuses more on suspense and special effects than character development and motivations that made the original THE POSEIDON ADVENTURE such a great sea epic. Josh Lucas seemed like an unlikely hero to lead the passengers to the surface through the bowels of the capsized SS Poseidon in Petersen's film. I found it so interesting that Kurt Russell took a second seat in many respects, because he has such a film presence as a natural born leader. Watching the film again recently, Josh Lucas gives a different kind of performance. He's kind of like the unexpected hero that rises to the occasion. It may or may not have worked, but Wolfgang Petersen's POSEIDON is suspenseful and it does have impressive effects that you can go back to admire the work that went into this film on a technical level.

I have come to love THE PERFECT STORM over the years. I suppose I expected something more when it first released. There was so much hype about the novel and the film. I see now that is such a personal story. Men who go down to the sea to make a living, trying to make a better life, men trying to survive day to day and not just men, but women too. In each crew member there lives a story. Dreams, love, the open air, the sea... they are such wonderful and noble things. I suppose I originally expected a story bigger than life, but THE PERFECT STORM is life, it is living and dying ...that is part of the circle. And James Horner's score, I see now that this is one of his greatest scores. It is beautiful, it is haunting, it is powerful and intimate. Director Wolfgang Petersen captured something special here. The characters and the cast that portrays them, all give powerful and moving performances. The amazing cast included George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, Diane Lane, William Fichtner, John C. Reilly, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, John Hawkes, Allen Payne, Christopher McDonald, Rusty Schwimmer, Janet Wright, Karen Allen, Michael Ironside and Joseph D. Reitman. That is how I feel about THE PERFECT STORM.

TWISTER is an interesting land based film that focuses on characters and one woman's eternal quest to meet nature face to face. It has a Saturday matinee quality to it and the cast of characters add to this beautifully. Director Jan de Bont takes an amazing story from a screenplay by Michael Crichton and Anne-Marie Martin and gives its cast a chance to have fun with it. The whole idea of down home storm chasers, Helen Hunt and Bill Paxton, trying to be outdone by corporate storm chasers, led by Cary Elwes, is quite amusing. A very animated Philip Seymour Hoffman as an over the top Dustin 'Dusty' Davis gives this film a lot of life. Once again the characters and good performances make this film work.

In all 3 films, mother nature takes on a personification of her own and like another character that drives conflict becomes an ominous and at times beautiful force.

I started out with a bucket list of 20-30 Must Have Blue-Rays right after I purchased my Blu-Ray player and I have found that these themed Triple Features are the perfect way to upgrade my DVD collection to Blu-Rays and, guess what? I often sell the three DVDs that these replace at a profit compared to what I pay for one Triple Feature ($9.99), so I am actually making money by upgrading to Blu-Rays! They also have all of the special features, etc. Of course, all three of these look great on Blu-Ray, which can't be said for every DVD in my collection. No need to replace most films from the 1940s and 1950s with Blu-Ray and there are only a handful from the 1960's that look better. 2001: A Space Odyssey, Dr. Strangelove, Lolita, Yellow Submarine, Spartacus, Lawrence of Arabia, To Kill a Mockingbird, Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, The Graduate, Psycho and the James Bond films comes to mind. I have yet to pay more than $9.99 for a Blue Ray in Like New condition, occasionally Very Good and I almost always make or at the very least, greatly defray the cost by selling my DVD of the same title, if I have it.
great movie all of them and in one case saves room and space so I can buy more to fit on shelves.

I was excited to see three of my favorite movies all in one for a super low price! Well technically three separate disk, but all in one case. I jumped at the chance to purchase them item! I was even more excited when I received it the next day! But little did I know that I was in for disappointment. Just as any other movie purchase, I quickly inserted the a disk into my (brand new  just bought 5 days ago) blu-ray player. I started with the movie 'Twister', but it kept freezing my blu-ray player after 11 seconds. It wouldn't even make it to the menu screen. At first I thought perhaps there was something wrong with my player, but that was not the case. After the 'Twister' movie froze my player, I couldn't even turn the blu-ray player off - I had to unplug it from the wall! Thinking that was just a glitch, I moved on to the next movie 'Poseidon'. There were NO problems - played great! Even watched it four times, because the picture was so great! But then disappointment set in once again when I inserted 'the perfect storm' into my blu-ray player. AGAIN after just 11 seconds, the disk wouldn't play and my blu-ray player YET AGAIN completely froze. ----- SIMPLE RETURN? You would think so because a normal store purchase would return or exchange, but not amazon. Unfortunately I had removed the outer plastic wrapping (had to remove plastic in order to test) this item is no longer eligible to return. ---- So to sum it up, three great movies - great price - disk wouldn't read properly! Unfortunately that left me paying $12.50 for one movie - Just BEWARE of this possibility.
looks like a counterfeit Chinese blu ray operation. case and dvds look cheesy and cheap but the quality is all i care about and they are definitely blu ray!

The Triple Blu Ray collection : Twister a disaster action drama film released in 1996 PG starring Helen Hunt & Bill Paxton as storm chasers chasing tornadoes across Oklahoma trying to perfect a data gathering instrument design to be released in to the funnel of a tornado called Dorothy while competing by a better funded team racing to get to the tornadoes outbreak first with a similar device also starring Jami Gertz , Cary Elwes and Philip Seymour Hoffman & directed by Jan De Bont from a screen play by Michael Chrichton & Anne Marie Martin & executive produces Steven Spielberg , Walter Parkes , Laurie Macdonald and Gerald R Molan .

Poseidon is a disaster film about a luxury cruise ship on a year end transatlantic crossing to New York & gets hit by a Rogue Wave tipping the ship up side down similar story to the original released in 72 by Paul Gallico's Novel The Poseidon Adventure except better especial affects & directed by Wolfgang Peterson released in 2006 PG with a good documentary by the History Channel about Rogue Waves starring Josh Lucas - Kurt Russel - Richard Dreyfuss - Emmy Rossum - Jacinda Barret - Mike Vogel - Mia Maestro - Jimmy Bennett - Kevin Dillon - Andre Braughter - Fergie and Freddy Rodriguez .

The Perfect Storm is another disaster Drama Action film  based on a true story directed by Wolf Gang Peterson released 2000 starring George Clooney - Mark Wahlberg - William Fitchner - John C. Reilly - Diana Lane - Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio - Karen Allen - Bob Gunton and Michael Ironside  based on a non fiction book released in 97 with the same title by Sebastian Junger about the crew of the Andrea Gail that got caught in the perfect storm of 1991 , The Sword fishing boat The Andrea Gail returns home to port in Gloucester Massachusets with a poor catch after a month out at sea and desperate for extra cash the crew went back out to sea after 2 days rest heading to the Flemish Cap where their luck improves unfortunate the ice machine breaks and the only way to sell their catch before it spoils is to hurry back with two powerful storms and a hurricane the crew underestimate and get caught up in the middle of the perfect storm .

The Triple Feature are Three Good Blu Ray Movies for a Great Price worth buying .

The movies are fine, Twister is one of my favorite movies ever. But I was disappointed with the blu-ray quality of Twister and Poseidon, The Perfect Storm was noticeable better, but the other two are very close to DVD quality. Probably a little better, but I'm still disappointed because they just don't look that great. Not much effort, if any, was put into restoring these. I guess I can't blame them, since these aren't blockbuster movies.

Each movie does come on its own full disc, so that is good. $10 is still a good price, even if these were standard DVD (even though they are close anyway) but I just can't give it more than 3 stars based on the poor blu ray quality.
Only came with a perfect storm

A fine collection of the classic disaster movies. The The Perfect Storm: A True Story of Men Against the Sea is a true story based on a well-researched and detailed book by Sebastian Junger. I read the book before the movie was produced and I wasn't disappointed. It really condensed the book but it would have been a 6 hour production to give it full justice. Twister is another of the generic 80s and 90s disaster movie genre. Good casting pitting the characters played by Helen Hunt and the late Bill Paxton. Another watchable movie based on the book by Michael Crichton. A book discussing the science and production of the movie,Twister: The Science of Tornadoes and the Making of an Adventure Movie is well worth a read for adults and children. Poseidon is a remake with more modern CG than the original. Missing is the outstanding original cast, but it's still entertaining.
